attributes.action: Endometriosis awareness campaign for women aged between 14-18 in Education
attributes.background: As a sufferer or Endometriosis I strongly believe if I was educated on the signs of Endometriosis I would have pushed for a earlier diagnosis which could effectively prevented mine from becoming so severe that it has taken over my life. I wish to take part in the campaign as i want to help others.
attributes.additional_details:
1 in 10 women suffer with Endometriosis 
There is no cure for Endometriosis 
Endometriosis needs to be bought into education 
Endometriosis causes infertility 
Women are unable to work due to severe Endometriosis 
Women face surgery just months apart because it rapidly grows back

attributes.action: Improve Availability of NHS Services for FND Sufferers
attributes.background: Functional Neurological Disorder sufferers are often left with limited & insufficient treatment options. Treatment requires a team of neurologists, physiotherapists etc. which must be integrated to create an effective plan. Currently, services are not equipped for this kind of specialist care.
attributes.additional_details: Up to 1/3 of all neurological referrals are diagnosed with FND. Sufferers end up relinquishing their independence & become reliant on a carer.  They are left unable to function & it’s vital we improve prospects. Medically Unexplained Symptoms (including FND) directly cost the NHS approximately £3.1 billion, with an additional £18 billion in indirect costs. With an NHS already under pressure, improving services and treatment for those with FND would greatly lift this burden.

attributes.action: The undersigned demand the following terms are included in any UK Brexit deal.
attributes.background: To include a deduction for the value of the UK’s share of funds held by the European Investment bank, EU loans, EU properties, cash and any other EU investments and assets, the total of which will offset any financial payment(s) made to the EU in whatever form as part of our final Brexit agreement.

attributes.action: Give the blood bike community section 19 exemptions for blue light runs
attributes.background:
There are 27 blood bike groups up and down the UK that respond to a call for help every night from their local NHS.
They willingly transport urgent medical supplies from hospital or hospital overnight free and voluntarily.
Help us get the emergency delivery to its destination sooner with S19
attributes.additional_details:
At present if the selected rider/driver receives a Blue Light call they can not:
• exceed the speed limit
• treat a red light as a give way
• go to the right of a keep left barrier
• Use audible warning equipment

E.G.
it's 2am, nothing on the road, they still have to:
• travel along EVERY road at the speed limit
• stand at a red light with nothing using the green light.

If we are granted section 19's that few minutes could be the difference in saving a life someday

attributes.action: Introduce the British Empire as a mandatory part of the Key Stage 3 curriculum
attributes.background: Currently the British Empire is an optional and small footnote on the History syllabus. A thorough and balanced mandatory module should be introduced to proportionally reflect the impact the Empire has had on our diverse UK population, and its impact on public attitudes towards immigration and race.

attributes.action: Require HMRC to separate out the cost of Brexit on personal tax statements.
attributes.background: The UK Government is taking us out of the EU whatever the cost. During the referendum campaign, much was made of the cost of membership of the EU. There will be costs to leave the EU - public sector time, research and consultancy fees, legal costs, repayments, and so on. These should be identified.
attributes.additional_details: The 'Vote Leave' campaign advertised a fee of £350m per week going to the EU (£18.2bn per year), while the ONS calculates the true value to be £9.9bn per year (http://visual.ons.gov.uk/uk-perspectives-2016-the-uk-contribution-to-the-eu-budget/). Brexit is predicted to cost an additional £60bn (https://www.ft.com/content/51a19263-9788-37b9-a9fa-8cd307265edf). This will have consequences for government spending and tax rates - taxpayers must be able to understand where their money is being used.

attributes.action: Make it mandatory all processed meat products carry a Government health warning
attributes.background:
In 2015 the World Health Organisation classified all processed meat products as group 1 carcinogens after extensive studies proved them to be a known cause of colorectal cancer
To date the Government has not acted responsibly and  failed to make this information widely known to the general public.
attributes.additional_details:
We would like to see a proper campaign to enlighten the public of the health risks if they are consuming these products, starting with making it mandatory to include a Government health warning on the packing of all processed meat products and removing all processed meat products  from schools. 

Link to the World Health Organisation information regarding processed meat:
http://www.who.int/features/qa/cancer-red-meat/en/

attributes.action: Maximum 30 day wait for anyone needing counselling for mental health issues
attributes.background: As someone who has battled mental health issues for the last 20 years. I’m sick of going to my G.P. and being told there’s a minimum 3 month waiting list. This isn’t good enough. I’m requesting that a maximum wait of 30 days be instilled.
attributes.additional_details:
It is wrong that depending on where you live, decides how quickly you receive NHS support for mental health. It is grossly under funded and massively under resourced.
5 times in the last 10 years I have been told there is a minimum 3 month wait for help, this is in the Richmond (York’s) constituency, one of the wealthiest in the country.
So I want a maximum 30 day wait.

attributes.action: Correct the flaws in our First-Past-The-Post voting system.
attributes.background:
Add score voting to the FPTP ballot; to correct its flaws, improve on its ability to produce strong governments, and strengthen its direct constituency link

Stand by 2011 AV referendum result by keeping the first past the post selection of MPs defining FPTP, but address the issues that lead to it
attributes.additional_details:
FPTP Currently: a voter marks one candidate, voters' marks are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

W/ Score Voting: a voter scores each candidate, voters' scores are tallied, and the candidate with the highest total wins

A minor ballot change can fix all of FPTP's flaws AND add to its strengths

Simple guide: endfptp.reddit.com/6xtbgh

Comprehensive guide: rangevoting.org

2017 GE Simulated w/ Score voting: endfptp.reddit.com/6lctda

Score vs. PR: endfptp.reddit.com/6gur0e

attributes.action: Do not extend IR35 legislation to the private sector.
attributes.background: There is evidence that the Chancellor is planning to extend IR35 legislation to the private sector in an attempt to equalise the payments and tax regimes between contractors and permanent employees. Contractors take considerable risk in their financial stability and can be without work for weeks.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/philip-hammond-eyes-1bn-budget-raid-on-freelancers-9bm6lsjs6

attributes.action: Ban greyhound racing, and all exports of dogs to any country including the eu
attributes.background: The greyhound racing industry is unable to regulate itself or stick to welfare restrictions. Injured dogs and those who do not make it to the races in the first place are abandoned or killed. Dogs exported abroad end up bred and/ or raced in countries with no welfare protection. Please end this.
attributes.additional_details: Please. Let's end this cruel and outdated industry now. Don't believe anyone who says there are strict welfare standards. They are not followed. Dogs are suffering here in the uk today. The dogs sent abroad, often via EU countries, to China, Pakistan etc, suffer even more. Make this a civilised country which protects those with no voice. Greyhounds and sighthounds are great companions. Racing is under 100 years old. It needs to stop now. Please.

attributes.action: Mandate that patients are told if their NHS referral is to a private provider.
attributes.background: NHS patients are often not informed when their referral is to a private and not an NHS provider. They are entitled to choose who provides their care and should not be referred to the private sector by default. Patients have a choice under the NHS Constitution and they should be informed of this.
attributes.additional_details: A relative needed an Opthalmology opinion and so was referred. The referral choices were to one private company with a choice of five venues. An NHS option was not given despite being available locally. This was because a block of care had been purchased from this private company in advance. A referral to the NHS would have meant a second payment for this care. Challenge by the relative resulted in an NHS appointment. This practice is unfair to both patient and the NHS and should stop.

attributes.action: Stop The Genocide In Myanmar - UK Government Please Help!
attributes.background: Hundreds have been forced to flee their villages as the emergency situation in Myanmar has worsened. Urgent needs of displaced people include water, hygiene facilities, food & shelter.
attributes.additional_details: The Burmese government, along with radical Burmese Buddhists, are attempting to exterminate the Rohingya people through direct violence and denial of rights. the Rohingya people have been denied basic human rights both inside their native Burma and have been subjected to routine forced labour, and have been resettled on unfarmable land while their previous lands have been confiscated and given to Buddhist settlers from elsewhere Violence and oppression in Burma have forced many Rohingya to flee.

attributes.action: Make Parental Alienation a Criminal act that can carry a custodial sentence.
attributes.background: If a Parent, Grandparent, Guardian, Relative or Organisation that is stopping a child from seeing their biological parents or parents on their birth certificate, without a lawful reason (Child safety with formal proof) should be given a custodial sentence, like Brazil.
attributes.additional_details: The Case Of John William Greer Vs Pauline Hutchinson and Larne First Serve Community Social Services (1997) - Father when to court to gain custody after being denied access to his son.

attributes.action: Stop the proposed Warrington Western Link
attributes.background:
We, the undersigned, call upon HM Government and Dept of transport NOT to fund the Warrington Western Link route. The negative impacts to the people of Warrington are too severe to warrant the;
- cost
- disruption
- increase in traffic
- destruction of greenbelt land
- increased air pollution

attributes.action: The MCA must send launch request to RNLI when fishing boats are reported overdue
attributes.background:
Fishing is the UK's most dangerous peacetime occupation. The Marine & Coastguard Agency must immediately task RNLI lifeboats when 
1) A fishing vessel is reported overdue by a harbour or family member. 2) A distress signal is received.
attributes.additional_details: Any delay in the MCA tasking the RNLI can mean the difference of life and death for a fisherman. There is not an RNLI crew in the country that would mind being called to station to launch, only later to be stood down because all is well with a vessel. A change of protocol to require the MCA to immediately task the local RNLI crews is needed urgently. Worse things happen at sea and even short delays can mean the difference between the rescue of a survivor, or the recovery of a body.

attributes.action: Make Helmet Therapy for Babies free on the NHS.
attributes.background:
Helmet therapy is for babies who suffer from Plagiocephaly or Bracheycephaly (flat head syndrome).
This can be developed in the first few months of the baby being born due to favouring sleeping on the one side or one way causing the skull to loose shape, and also causing facial deformities.
attributes.additional_details:
This treatment has been proven to work with a positive, visual outcome in all babies that go through Helmet Therapy around the world!  It's currently not available on the NHS forcing parents to pay over £2,000 for the treatment on their own.
I have a 7 month old son going through Helmet Therapy and the results already are dramatic! Most parents can not afford this and really don't understand why it is not available on the NHS? Helmet therapy does work and needs more awareness raised!

attributes.action: Reduce student loan interest to an affordable 1% over base rate.
attributes.background: With the current punitive and profiteering rate of RPI + 3% typical loans of £50k require a salary of £55k pa just to pay the £3,000 interest. The rate charged is excessive and leaves a lifetime millstone for most graduate leavers. Give the majority an attainable goal and a sense of hope!

attributes.action: Change law and tax rules to ensure equal pay for equal work for agency workers
attributes.background: Many workers work through agencies using umbrella companies to handle pay. This is used to pay workers less by avoiding Employers NI. ENI is deducted from workers’ wages. This petition seeks a law to prevent workers getting less take-home pay than directly employed people doing work of equal value.
attributes.additional_details: There must be equal take-home pay for equal work for agency workers. Umbrella companies say that workers agree to work like this, but we know in the industry that this is not so and that workers are not given a choice and must go umbrella if they want to get employment. This is a widespread practice that is  hurting the pockets of vulnerable workers.

attributes.action: Make General Practice recognised as a specialism in the UK
attributes.background: General practice is the foundation of the NHS, yet even though doctors undergo rigorous training to become a GP, including an exit exam (MRCGP) they are still not recognised as specialists. The UK is an outlier compared to other countries across the globe.
attributes.additional_details:
Recently UEMO (the European Union of General Practitioners/Family Physicians) called for all European countries to recognise the speciality and the statement has the support of other European 
medical organisations.

In August 2016 the RCGP released this press statement http://www.rcgp.org.uk/news/2016/august/gps-must-be-recognised-as-specialists-in-general-practice-say-rcgp-and-the-bma.aspx , but to date there continues to be no movement on their call.

attributes.action: Urge the Government to support the construction of a Sudbury bypass.
attributes.background: The town of Sudbury, Suffolk has suffered from heavy congestion for too long, hampering the development of the town, causing dangerous levels of pollution and reducing the living standards of its residents.
attributes.additional_details:
The Sudbury Bypass Campaign already has a strong initial business case, the support of Suffolk County Council, the New Anglia Local Enterprise Partnership and the Haven Gateway Partnership.

This petition asks that the Government provides support for the construction of a Sudbury bypass, including any necessary funding, to improve the future of the town and surrounding areas.

attributes.action: Debate: The EU referendum is now invalid due to demographic changes over time.
attributes.background: 1.2m people made up the leave majority. 600,000 uk people die each year, the same join the electorate. 2/3 of older voters are leavers. 2/3 of younger voters are remainders. The referendum is valid for a short time only before it ceases to represent the will of the people.

attributes.action: Raise Statutory Sick Pay for Cancer suffers to minimal wage& extend to 52 weeks.
attributes.background: No person within the UK diagnosed with Cancer should be put into financial difficulties by a large reduction of their income due to Cancer. In some instances, an employer may have a 4 or 8-week full Company sick pay, but after this time, their income drops to the current Statutory Sick Pay.
attributes.additional_details: I am currently employed by a one of the largest UK High street retailers and diagnosed with Cancer on the 15th Sept 2017. On the 2nd Oct (36 hours before I had Cancer surgery), my employer sat me down & informed me that I would NOT be getting paid while I was off recovering from Cancer. I have received my examples through Social Media of similar practices by this employer and by many other UK companies

attributes.action: Stop The Closure Of Darlington A&E
attributes.background: We can’t let Darlington A&E close down. It will cause people to travel excessive distances and if they don't have a car this may not be possible. It will also put strain on the out of town hospitals and will endanger lives that are emergencies.
attributes.additional_details: The Last petition closed early because of a General Election with 7,313 signatures

attributes.action: Ban the sale of White poppies alongside the British Legion red poppy campaign.
attributes.background: Ban the sale of white poppies in November, alongside the RBL Campaign as it is nothing more than a political move that detracts from the good work the legion do and make a mockery of the official remembrance campaign and those that gave their lives for this country.
attributes.additional_details: The white poppy campaign states that it remembers all war dead, which would include civilians and enemy combatants. Not just the enemy of old, but also the despicable fighters from groups like ISIL, who advocate rape and torture. While there is no issue with remembering more than just British Forces personnel who have given their lives, there is a great issue with doing this alongside the official campaign. The white poppy should only be sold at other times of the year.

attributes.action: End the Help to Buy scheme and instead direct this funding into social housing
attributes.background: The UK government's funding of the Help to Buy scheme constitutes a fundamental misuse of public funds and fails to deliver the much needed affordable housing for the people of the UK. Property developers are profiteering at the nation's expense whilst failing to provide homes we so desperately need

attributes.action: Change the law to get justice for unborn babies killed in the womb during RTA's
attributes.background: When I was 24 weeks pregnant, my son was tragically killed in the womb after I was involved in a major car crash. People who cause road traffic accidents that kill babies in the womb can’t be charged with “death by dangerous driving” as in the eyes of the law a baby in the womb is not a person.
attributes.additional_details: As my son was born after 24 weeks he was classed as stillborn. He has a birth certificate and a death certificate. On his death certificate, his cause of death was written as 'road traffic accident' by medical professionals and signed. It's now also been proven I suffered placenta abruption as a result of the impact of the crash on my bump. If he was 1 day old or 1 week old the driver could be charged! My son had his whole life ahead of him and will never get justice!

attributes.action: Amend PIP rules so that mentally disabled adults can get a Blue Parking Badge.
attributes.background: Currently rules on Personal Independence Payments mean that mobility points, which allow people to access a Blue Badge for disability parking, are allocated on physical capacity to walk, only, not a mental impairment. This is demonstrably unrealistic and impacts people with disabilities and carers
attributes.additional_details: My learning disabled daughter Emily can physically walk but this doesn't mean she can always do so safely. My mum had dementia, she was able to walk but unable to appreciate the dangers around her. A Blue Badge is a passport to understanding and to life. To refuse to allocate a blue badge, unless a person's ability to walk is affected, is morally and factually wrong.This needs to be addressed and urgently amended, so that all disabled people are treated equally by the authorities and by society.

attributes.action: End the United Kingdom's trading of weapons to Saudi Arabia
attributes.background: Thousands of innocent Yemenese women and children are being slaughtered by our weapons in which we sell to Saudi Arabia; this selfish means of trading needs to be abruptly halted before thousands more innocent civilians die as a consequence.

attributes.action: Universal Credit applicants to receive adequate payments throughout assessment.
attributes.background: Currently Universal Credit applicants can have no income for a minimum of 6 weeks after application. This causes hardship and distress and a legacy of debt and arrears. They need an income, not a loan. Citizens Advice report the wait for first Universal Credit payments can be as long as 10 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: Housing Associations and private landlords have the right to trigger eviction after 8 weeks of rent arrears. COSLA has found that in areas where full rollout of Universal Credit has taken place, the level of rent arrears is at least 2.5 times that of those areas still in receipt of housing benefit. Last year, foodbanks in areas of full Universal Credit rollout have seen a 16.85% average increase in referrals for emergency food, more than double the national average of 6.64%.

attributes.action: Change CICA policy that states children age 12+ can “consent in fact” to sex
attributes.background:
Children from age 12y could be refused compensation for sexual abuse on grounds they consented under revised rules.
The Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) review of its guidelines revealed that almost 700 child victims were denied payments, even where the attacker was jailed.
attributes.additional_details:
The age of consent is 16 for good reason. It reflects the cognitive, emotional and social development required as an absolute minimum to consent to sex. The current CICA guidelines flies in face of this, notwithstanding ignoring the context in which "consent" occurs. Coercion, fear and manipulation are part of these offences and as such "consent in fact" is null and void. 
Such victim blaming is wrong, unhelpful and psychologically damaging. As such, this should be fully debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Introduce interim “pub cap” and a full review of the business rate system
attributes.background: Pubs in St Albans and parts of England have been hit with extortionate business rate increases due to property values increasing over the past decade. We believe there needs to be a fundamental review on the business rate system to stop pubs disappearing from our villages, towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details: We are calling for an immediate interim "Pub Cap" limiting increases in rates bills to 12.5% in England (currently operating in Scotland) and a fundamental review of the whole system to ensure that pubs can survive and this British community asset will not be lost forever.

attributes.action: Having knocked over a cat, the driver must legally stop to help/trace the owner
attributes.background: We have lost two cats to road traffic accidents. On both occasions the drivers did not stop to check if the cat could be saved. It is a criminal offence not to stop and report an accident involving a dog. Whilst cats are more independent they are still a beloved pet and should be respected equally.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
With ever more jobs becoming automatable, risking vast unemployment, a regular unconditional dividend should be paid to every citizen to provide a decent standard of living and stimulate the economy from the bottom up.

This will also reduce crime, healthcare costs and improve education outcomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a further list of reasons to pay a basic income: http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

And some preliminary results from a trial in Finland: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/05/finlands-basic-income-experiment-is-already-making-people-feel-better-after-just-4-months

And a study into the likely impact of automation on future employment:
http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/academic/The_Future_of_Employment.pdf

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Brexit once a final agreement with the EU agreed.
attributes.background: Whether we stay or go, I believe that final decision should only be based on clear and understandable information. It is clear that our and EU politicians are more interested in their own politicking rather than ensuring a stable and highly productive Country/Countries.
attributes.additional_details: Inner city Manchester Born and Bred. Degree in Economics. Lived in Moss Side/Whalley Range, Weybridge, Warsaw, Geneva and now back in Weybridge. Have two exceptional daughters for whom I have the only desire to leave a better world for them and future generations. Incredible friends around the world. Together we are something, alone we are nothing. Let's make sure any decision we reach is based on fact not fiction.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hand guns and allow everyone to own any firearm.
attributes.background: It's about time the ban on handguns and civilians owning them was lifted. The only people affected by the ban are law abiding citizens that lost their right to own firearms. The ban hasn't stopped criminals from buying or using firearms at all.

attributes.action: Voluntary Right to Buy (VRTB) Scheme for Housing Associations - Update Needed
attributes.background: This petition calls for an update from UK government on the Voluntary Right to Buy Scheme which proposes for the Right to Buy to be extended to Housing Association tenants in England (as pledged in Conservative Manifesto in 2015, piloted with 5 associations and gaining Royal Assent in 2016).
attributes.additional_details:
The government should confirm intentions to deliver the scheme nationally as pledged in 2015. Detail is needed on the timeline for when the scheme will be rolled out nationally, and what the criteria will be for those wishing to apply to purchase their home. 

www.twitter.com/RTBforHA
www.facebook.com/RTBforHA/

attributes.action: Negotiate with the EU the possibility of direct EU citizenship for UK nationals
attributes.background: 16,141,241 voters chose to remain in the EU in 2016's referendum - nearly 4 times the size of the Republic of Ireland's population. Their rights as EU citizens are being taken away. Negotiate with the EU the possibility of these individuals' maintaining their EU citizenship should they desire it.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens of the EU benefit from many rights that UK nationals are at risk of losing as a result of Brexit. These include the right to live, travel, work, or study without hindrance in 27 other countries. European citizenship exists as a complement to citizenship of a member state. If the UK ceases to be an EU member state, these rights will be lost. Negotiate the possibility of retention of these rights for those UK nationals who still wish to be EU citizens, rather than citizens of nowhere.

attributes.action: I want our country to increase our defence budget to 5% GDP to protect us better
attributes.background: We need to increase our defence budget. The world today is even more unpredictable and dangerous than it's ever been, from the likes of Russia and China being more assertive. I want the UK to be prepared for any major conflict that may come to light in the future and protect our citizens better.

attributes.action: Impose a mandatory life sentence for acid attacks
attributes.background: The effects of vitriolage on a victim are lifelong, therefore a life sentence is the only fair way to deal with the perpetrator. Mandatory life sentences would also act as a deterrent, and reduce the number of such heinous attacks in London.

attributes.action: Remove rip-off compound interest from student loans
attributes.background: Student loans charge a huge 6.1% interest, even during study. Worse, the 6.1% is compounded monthly, meaning interest is added to the loans every month, making loans bigger, so the next month the interest costs even more; the loans get bigger and interest costs increase every month. It is a rip-off.
attributes.additional_details: Even though the base rate is only 0.25%, students are exploited by horrendous 6.1% interest, compounded monthly, being charged on their loans – this can double or treble the size of the loans and massively increase interest costs, too. Most ‘normal’ loans do not do this. It is exploitative. No wonder student loans get bigger even while borrowers are paying off their loans. Sign the petition to remove interest from student loans. More info. here: https://www.afairdealforstudents.com/

attributes.action: Make the teaching of Sexual consent  compulsory In schools
attributes.background:
Rape, Sexual abuse and harassment are prevalent issues effecting our society. 

More needs to be done to tackle these issues. Children need to be taught what constitutes consentual sex and what actions are considered Sexual abuse and harassment as part of the compulsory national curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
The teaching of consent in schools is currently not compulsory. 

85,000 women and 12,000 men are raped in England and Wales alone every year

1 in 5 women aged 16 - 59 has experienced some form of sexual violence since. 

Some references:
https://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
https://www.theguardian.com/education/2015/mar/09/sexual-consent-lessons-government-criticised-pshea-inadequate

attributes.action: Put Stonehenge into special measures Remove Stonehenge from EH Management
attributes.background: Since splitting with Historic England, English Heritage has commercialized Stonehenge to the extreme introducing a 'Pay to Pray' Policy at Solstices and priced Tourism out of reach for the General Public to whom it was left, and supported unsuitable road improvements in the World Heritage site.
attributes.additional_details: They have rejected the advice and concerns of UNESCO, Senior Archaeologists, Historians, Druids, and Environmentalists. This shows they are not fit to manage the 'Jewel in the Crown' of a World Heritage site.

attributes.action: Stop electoral fraud by creating a national database of voters
attributes.background: There is insufficient rigour applied to the voting process and it is open to error and fraud because it is not national, has insufficient identity checks on an individual, and does not include an individual’s voting rights. A national database and appropriate identity checks would resolve this.
attributes.additional_details:
An individual, e.g. student or home-owner, may have two places of residence, in different local authorities. They are entitled to vote in both local authority elections but by law they are only allowed to vote once in a national election.
The individual does not have to specify at which residence they would like to cast their national vote, so they receive two polling cards and whilst it is illegal to vote twice there is no validation carried out to stop this.

attributes.action: Make performing a cosmetic surgical procedure without relevant insurance illegal
attributes.background: Practitioners who choose to operate without relevant insurance and who make mistakes are ruining lives and costing the NHS millions of pounds for putting right botched operations.  Rogue practitioners currently do not face the threat of criminal action if they don't have relevant insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: The past 10 years has seen a significant increase in cosmetic procedures carried out in the UK within an industry which remains largely unregulated.  Consequently, there has also been an alarming increase in patients using NHS services to correct failed cosmetic procedures as a result of under-insured /uninsured practitioners. Due to a long existing  data vacuum, the true cost to the NHS is unknown, potentially running to tens of thousands per patient.

attributes.action: Use Foreign Aid budget for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly.
attributes.background: The Foreign Aid budget currently stands at £13bn. This is far too high. We believe charity begins at home and that the Foreign Aid budget should be used for the NHS, Adult Social care and the elderly who have been the backbone of our country.

attributes.action: British citizens should be able to appeal the refusal of a family 'visit visa'
attributes.background:
The appeals process for Family Visit Visa was removed on 25 June, 2013 to save costs. My recent personal experience confirmed that the UKBA seem to have cut the process of justice and accountability while cutting their costs. How can this be justified?
Is UKBA now the Judge, Jury and Executioner?
attributes.additional_details:
In response to my query to UKBA I got back a ‘blank’ email with the request to fill out a satisfaction survey! My mother was rejected a visit visa recently and she was told not to apply within next 10 years. She is now 66. Which essentially means she may not possibly visit her grandchildren in UK for the rest of her lifetime. UKBA's rejection has no regards to how it affects me as a British Citizen. Why should UKBA be allowed to impose decisions without due and just care? 
Stop this INJUSTICE!

attributes.action: Introduce automatic penalties when a contact order is broken repeatedly.
attributes.background: There are many cases documented where one parent repeatedly breaks the Contact Order without penalty and the injured party (normally the father) has to keep going back to Court, at their expense, to try and see their child. This often results in fathers losing contact with their child.
attributes.additional_details: Introducing more stringent automatic penalties when a parent repeatedly breaks a contact order without good reason will help keep parents in their children’s lives. We would also like a named body that can investigate when a contact order is breached. In many European countries, the police intervene immediately to ensure the rights of the child to see their non-resident parent are protected. The existing system is too slow and unwieldy and the penalties are unenforceable.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.

attributes.action: Regulate land management companies: cap charges and increase transparency
attributes.background: Cap land maintenance price increases at the same rate as inflation to stop large price increases (we had nearly 30% this year); require management fees to be fixed in contracts, to stop extra fees; and require invoices for extra charges to prove works are carried out and not to be excessive.
attributes.additional_details: I live on an estate which has green areas owned by a company which charges home owners for maintaining this land. They charge for works with no proof of work being carried out. This year they raised the price by 29.4% per month raising the price by £53.18 a month, costing an extra £638.16 per year! The company do not carry out the agreed works properly and demand payments or legal action will be taken against home owners for non-payment. The company also do not deal with complaints efficiently.
